intro: Michelia philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine Michelia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Magnoliaceae and is characterized by its fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized evergreen tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and ovate, with a smooth surface and a pointed tip. The fruit is a follicle that splits open to release its seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
